sentence: I have a step-stool and never met my real stool
explanation: A stool can refer to a seat or a specific form of excrement.
first_new_sentence: I bought a new stool for my workshop so I can work more comfortably.
second_new_sentence: The doctor indicated that the stool sample was necessary for testing.

sentence: What did the cannibal do after dumping his girlfriend? wiped his ass.
explanation: An ass can refer to a donkey or a persons buttocks.
first_new_sentence: The farmer has an ass that helps him plow the fields.
second_new_sentence: The child fell and landed directly on his ass, crying out in pain.

sentence: What did the orphan get for christmas? lonely.
explanation: Lonely can refer to feeling alone or to a lack of companionship.
first_new_sentence: After moving to the new city, Sarah felt incredibly lonely without her friends around.
second_new_sentence: The lonely wolf howled at the moon, searching for a pack.

sentence: Please note that not all jokes provided meet the specific criteria of having two different meanings as outlined (one word with two meanings both spelled the same), so the output includes only those that qualified.
